name: Smoked Chipotle Tomato Basil Soup
author: Colorado Connie
summary: A rich and flavorful soup that is quick and easy to prepare. Tomato and basil meld together with the smoky spice of mild tabasco sauce as well as the kick of bloody mary mix. Also a great base for vegetable-based soups or as a topping for appetizers.
ingredients: 1 (28 ounce) can crushed tomatoes (such as Hunt's®)
1 cup tomato and clam juice cocktail
¾ cup bottled bloody mary mix (such as Zing Zang®)
3 dashes chipotle-flavored hot sauce (such as Tabasco® Chipotle Pepper Sauce), or more to taste
directions: Heat olive oil in a 2-quart saucepan over low heat; cook and stir garlic until lightly browned, about 5 minutes
Stir in tomatoes and increase heat to medium; simmer for 10 minutes
Stir in chicken broth, tomato and clam juice cocktail, bloody mary mix, basil, hot sauce, garlic salt, and black pepper
Partially cover saucepan with lid and simmer until reduced, about 20 minutes
Reduce heat to low and add half-and-half; stir until heated through, about 5 minutes more
